snippet: The tribes and the central government, often at odds, find mutual benefit in uniting against a common enemy, the Islamic State.
abstract: Successful deal between Aza tribe of Sunnis and local Iraqi police and military officials results in liberation of 13 villages from Islamic State; such wary alliances offer early glimmer of hope for long-term cooperation between Shiite-led security forces and Sunni tribes.

byline.contributor: Ali Hamza and Omar al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and employees of The New York Times from Baquba, Mosul, Ramadi, Suleimaniyah and Tikrit, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: The tribes and the central government, often at odds, find mutual benefit in uniting against a common enemy, the Islamic State.

headline.main: Wary Tribal Alliances, Born of Necessity, Offer Hope in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Wary Alliances, Born of Necessity, Offer Hope in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
